intro: Gutierrezia isernii var. isernii, commonly known as Isern's brittlebrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. It has slender, branched stems and small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gutierrezia isernii var. isernii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
